intro: Galium tenderiense, commonly known as the tender bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes, forming dense mats. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a soft, hairy texture. Galium tenderiense is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodland floors and stream banks.
